 Justine Bakker
Description
 Hoe hebben ideeen over ras de religiewetenschap in het "Westen" beÃ¯nvloed? In
mijn onderzoek analyseer ik in welke mate religie als autonome en unieke categorie en
onafhankelijk onderzoeksveld werd gelegitimeerd door een "racialized project of distinction." Dit
concept duidt zowel op de constante neiging tot het maken van fundamenteel onderscheid als op
de scheidslijnen zelf. Mijn hypothese luidt: 1) vooraanstaande theorien over religie waren vaak
gestoeld op fundamenteel onderscheid: heilig/profaan, religieus/seculier,
primitief/geciviliseerd;en 2) deze (behoefte aan) scheidslijnen werden gevormd en versterkt door
de ontwikkeling van raciale categorieen en hierarchien en droegen hieraan bij (dwz "racialized").
Mijn onderzoek is vernieuwend omdat het centrale teksten in de religiewetenschap (zoals die van
Tylor, Muller, Frazer en Eliade) bestudeert vanuit het oogpunt van filosofische werken in "black
studies." Ik breng zo twee onderzoeksvelden bij elkaar die vaak gescheiden zijn. Het onderzoek
is actueel en urgent omdat het bestuderen van de relatie tussen ras en religie bijdraagt aan het
dekoloniseren van het begrip religie en het bestuderen daarvan; zowel in de wetenschap als in
het publieke domein. Door te onderzoeken op welke, vaak subtiele, manier ideeen over ras een
rol hebben gespeeld in de begripsvorming van religie, draagt mijn werk ook bij aan de kennis
over hoe en waarom ras en "religie" tot op heden een belangrijke rol spelen in het leven in
Europa.

 KU Leuven

No
Do existing 3rd party agreements restrict dissemination or exploitation of the data
you (re)use? If so, to what data do they relate and what restrictions are in place?
The Eliade papers do not restrict access or citations; I will have to determine, once
I’ve visited the archive, whether I can obtain permission to published the archival
material that I will use online.
4. Documentation and metadata
What documentation will be provided to enable reuse of the data collected/generated
in this project?
All archival material will be clearly labeled and organized; notes will be labeled and
organized, and stored in RDR (I will include a “readme” file which will help future
readers understand my process and notes).
Will a metadata standard be used? If so, 
describe in detail which standard will be
used. 
If no, state in detail which metadata will be created to make the data
easy/easier to find and reuse.
Yes
I will likely use the Dublin Core metadata standard to systematize the archival data in
Tropy.
5. Data storage and backup during the FWO project
Where will the data be stored?
Personal laptop, OneDrive (protected with multifactor identification)
How is backup of the data provided?
I will preserve my research notes and recorded conversations on my laptop as well as
a OneDrive account. I will secure written permission from each participant before I
will make the podcast episodes available to the public.
Is there currently sufficient storage & backup capacity during the project? If yes,
specify concisely. If no or insufficient storage or backup capacities are available then
explain how this will be taken care of.
Yes
Yes. KU Leuven OneDrive has 2TB, which far exceeds the volume of data that will be
collected.
What are the expected costs for data storage and back up during the project? How
will these costs be covered?
None
Data security: how will you ensure that the data are securely stored and not accessed
or modified by unauthorized persons?
Laptop and OneDrive are protected with different passwords; OneDrive is protected
by multifactor identifcation 
6. Data preservation after the FWO project
Which data will be retained for the expected 5 year period after the end of the
project? In case only a selection of the data can/will be preserved, clearly state the
reasons for this (legal or contractual restrictions, physical preservation issues, ...).

All data will be retained
Where will the data be archived (= stored for the longer term)?
The data will be stored on the university's RDR data repository, in line with the KU
Leuven RDM policy.
What are the expected costs for data preservation during the retention period of 5
years? How will the costs be covered?
No additional costs
7. Data sharing and reuse
Are there any factors restricting or preventing the sharing of (some of) the data (e.g.
as defined in an agreement with a 3rd party, legal restrictions)?
It is possible that the archive "Eliade Papers" provides scans on the condition that
they will be for personal use. It is therefore possible that I will not be able to share
these with third parties
Which data will be made available after the end of the project?
To the extent that I am allowed to, I will make the archival material available for third
person use.
Where/how will the data be made available for reuse?
In an Open Access repository
If allowed, I will make the archival material available through RDR.
When will the data be made available?
Upon publication of the results. Per FWO policy, this will be open access.
Who will be able to access the data and under what conditions?
If allowed: KU Leuven researchers and, upon email request, other interested third
parties
What are the expected costs for data sharing? How will the costs be covered?
No additional costs
8. Responsibilities
Who will be responsible for data documentation & metadata?
I will be responsible for daily usage; my supervisor Prof. Dr. Judith Gruber will be the
end responsible for data management.
Who will be responsible for data storage & back up during the project?
I will be responsible for daily usage; my supervisor Prof. Dr. Judith Gruber will be the
end responsible for data management.
Who will be responsible for ensuring data preservation and reuse ?
I will be responsible for daily usage; my supervisor Prof. Dr. Judith Gruber will be the
end responsible for data management.
Who bears the end responsibility for updating & implementing this DMP?
I will be responsible updating and implementing this DMP; my supervisor Prof. Dr.
Judith Gruber will be the end responsible for data management.
